display_name: Individual Dignity Identity v Tribal Identity
description: Individual Dignity Identity v Tribal Identity - A specialized Narrative Gravity Map implementation focusing on the tension between individual dignity and tribal identity in persuasive discourse.

positioning_strategy.description: Wells are fixed at 90 and 270 degrees to represent the identity dipole.

Dignity.description: Individual Dignity Identity well fixed at 90 degrees.

Tribalism.description: Tribal Identity well fixed at 270 degrees.

dipoles.name: Identity
dipoles.description: Moral worth and group membership dynamics

positive.name: Dignity
positive.description: Affirms individual moral worth and universal rights, regardless of group identity. Emphasizes agency, pluralism, and character over affiliation.

negative.name: Tribalism
negative.description: Prioritizes group dominance, loyalty, or identity over individual agency. Often frames moral worth in in-group/out-group terms.

Dignity.description: Analysis dimension for individual dignity in narrative content

Tribalism.description: Analysis dimension for tribal identity in narrative content

primary_sources: Fukuyama, F. (2018). Identity: The Demand for Dignity and the Politics of Resentment.
Jung, C. G. (1921). Psychological Types. (Concepts of Individual vs. Collective Identity)
theoretical_foundation.theoretical_approach: This framework examines narratives through the lens of individual dignity versus tribal identity, drawing on theories of identity formation and collective psychology. It analyzes how language reinforces or challenges the tension between personal autonomy and group allegiance.

com.name: Center of Mass
com.description: Weighted center position considering signed weights

nps.name: Narrative Polarity Score
nps.description: Distance from center normalized by circle radius

dps.name: Directional Purity Score
dps.description: Consistency of integrative vs disintegrative pull
